japanese: らいはちゃん、夕食はどうでした？
translation: Raiha-chan, how was dinner?

japanese:
すっごく美味しかった！
お腹いっぱいだよ。
translation: It was super delicious! I'm so full!

japanese:
一部、なにを食べているか
よくわからなかったが、とにかく美味かったな。
translation:
I couldn't quite tell what some of the dishes were,
but they were all really tasty.

japanese:
沖縄の料理って
珍しい食材を使ってる物も多いもんねー。
有名なのは知ってるけど。
translation:
Okinawan cuisine often uses unusual ingredients,
doesn't it.
Though that is what it's famous for.

japanese:
デザートのケーキもさすがの味でした！
五月が驚くくらいですから相当ですよ。
translation:
The cake for dessert was also amazing!
It was so good that it surprised Itsuki.
Now that's a good cake!

japanese:
（食事のあと、らいはに誘われて
　２人の部屋に来たが……
　いつも以上のはしゃぎっぷりだな）
translation:
(After dinner, Raiha invited me to their room,
 and they were even more energetic than usual.)

japanese:
（豪華なホテルにレストランでの食事。
　それに明日からは観光……
　テンションが上がるのも無理ないか）
translation:
(We're staying at a luxurious hotel, and dining
 at a restaurant. Plus, we're starting our sightseeing
 tomorrow...it's no wonder they're so excited.)

japanese:
でも、いいのかな。
１日目からこんなに楽しんじゃって。
translation:
But, is it okay to be having this much fun
on the first day?

japanese:
いいんですよ、らいはちゃん。
そのために来たんですから！
translation:
It's okay, Raiha-chan.
We came here to have fun, after all!

japanese:
今回の旅は楽しいアクティビティ満載の
欲張りプランですからね、まだまだ楽しめますよ。
translation:
This trip is an extravagant adventure
filled with exciting activities,
so there's still room to have more fun.

japanese: 欲張りプランかぁ～。
translation: An extravagant adventure, huh...

japanese:
そうだ、四葉さんが作ってくれた旅のしおり、
見直しておこうよ。
持ってくる！
translation:
Oh, that reminds me, let's review
the travel guide that Yotsuba-san made.
I'll go get it!

japanese:
四葉。
らいはも誘ってくれてありがとな。
translation: Yotsuba, thank you for inviting Raiha.

japanese:
いえいえ、私は思いついて提案しただけですから。
一花たちも賛成してくれましたし。
translation:
Don't worry about it, I only suggested it.
Ichika and the others were the ones who
agreed to it.

japanese:
そうか。
なんつーか……
姉妹とも、その後はうまくやっていけてるみたいだな。
translation:
I see. It's just that...
After that, it seems
things with your sisters have gotten better.

japanese:
（俺が告白してしばらくは、
　やっぱりギクシャクしてたし……）
translation:
(After I confessed,
 things were awkward for a while...)

japanese:
はい。
その節はご心配をおかけして、すみませんでした。
translation:
Okay.
I'm sorry for worrying you
so much back then.

japanese:
別に謝ることじゃねぇよ。
それに、ちゃんと話し合って解決しようなんて
身内でもなかなかできないことだ。
translation:
There's no need to apologize.
Besides, it's not easy for family members
to discuss and resolve issues like that.

japanese: そうですね……。
translation: That's right...

japanese:
もちろん変化はありましたよ？
でも、もう大丈夫です。
translation:
Of course, things have changed since then, you know?
But everything's okay now.

japanese:
だって……いま、私が上杉さんの隣にいられるのも
みんなのおかげなんですから。
translation:
Cause, like...
Thanks to everyone.
I can be next to you now.

japanese:
私が変われたように、
みんなもちゃんと前に進んでるんです。
translation:
Just like how I was able to change,
everyone else is moving forward too.

japanese: そうか。
translation: I see.

japanese: えへへ……。
translation: Ehehe...

japanese:
……ら、らいは？
なにをニヤニヤ見てるんだ？
translation:
...R-Raiha?
Why are you grinning like that?

japanese: 四葉さんとお兄ちゃんは仲良しさんだなーって。
translation: I was just thinking, you two get along so well.

japanese:
え、ええと、そうですね……。
あははは……。
translation:
U-umm, I guess so...
Ahahaha...

japanese:
ねえねえ、四葉さん。
お兄ちゃん、告白の時はなんて言ったの？
translation:
Hey, hey, Yotsuba-san.
What did big bro say when he confessed?

japanese: ぶっはぁ！？
translation: PFFTUH?!

japanese: ふえぇっ！？
translation: FWEEH?!

japanese:
ちょ、ちょ、ちょっと待て！
本人の前で聞くことじゃないだろ！？
translation:
H-h-hold on a sec!
You can't just ask that in front of me!

japanese: じゃあ、お兄ちゃんがいない時ならいいんだ。
translation:
Oh, okay. Then, if big bro isn't here,
will you tell me?

japanese:
それもダメだ！
四葉も、らいはの頼みだからって
ペラペラしゃべるんじゃないぞ！？
translation:
W-what?! No way! And Yotsuba,
don't just blurt things out
because Raiha asked you to, okay?!

japanese:
だそうです。
ごめんなさい、らいはちゃん。
translation:
I'm in total agreement with him.
I'm sorry, Raiha-chan.

japanese: ぶ～、お兄ちゃんのケーチー！
translation: Booo, you're so STINGY, big bro!

japanese: 枕で殴ってもダメなものはダメだ。
translation:
Some things I just won't let up on,
even if you hit me with a pillow.

japanese: お兄ちゃんが降参するまでやめない！
translation: I won't stop until you surrender, big bro!

japanese:
はっはっは！
そんな攻撃がこの俺に通じると思っているのかぁ？
translation:
Ha-ha-ha! Do you really think that kind of attack
will work on me?

japanese:
（あんな恥ずかしい話をらいはに知られるのは勘弁だ。
　しばらく我慢すれば疲れて諦めるだろうし、
　そのタイミングで、なにか別の話題に……）
translation:
(I don't want Raiha to hear about my embarrassments.
 If I wait a little longer, she'll get tired and give
 up, and then we can talk about something else...)

japanese:
あれっ？
ねえ、四葉さん？
translation:
Huh?
Say, Yotsuba-san?

japanese: はい、なんでしょう？
translation: Yes, what is it?

japanese:
なんで枕がたくさんあるの？
私の分と四葉さんの分なら２つでいいのに。
translation:
Why are there so many pillows here?
We only need two, one for me and one for you.

japanese:
そ、それは、その……私がホテルにお願いして
用意してもらったんですが……。
translation:
W-well, um... I asked the hotel
to prepare them for us...

japanese:
あっ！
もしかしてお兄ちゃんが
部屋に泊まっていく用だったり？
translation:
Ah! Could it be that you were planning
to stay in this room, big bro?

japanese: ぶっはぁ！？
translation: PFFTUH?!

japanese:
ええええっ！？
違います！　違いますって！
translation:
WHAAA?!
That's not it! Not it at all!

japanese:
（あ、違うのか……
　って、なにをがっかりしてるんだよ俺！）
translation:
(Oh, it's not... I see...
 Wait, why am I disappointed?!)

japanese: あの、お恥ずかしい話なんですが……。
translation: Um, this is a bit embarrassing to admit, but...

japanese:
実は私、寝相がすごく悪いんです。
だから寝る時はいつも足元にもう１個、
枕を置いてるんですよ。
translation:
Actually, I'm a really bad sleeper.
So I always put another pillow at the foot of the bed
when I sleep.

japanese:
ほら、ベッドの両側に枕があれば、
寝てるあいだに体の向きが変わっちゃっても
安心じゃないですか。
translation:
Like, if there are pillows on both ends of the bed,
I don't have to worry about changing positions
while I sleep.

japanese: ああ、そういうことなんだ。
translation: Oh, so that's why.

japanese:
どれだけ寝相が悪ければ
そういう思考に行き着くんだ……。
translation:
I wonder how bad your sleep has to be
to come up with an idea like that...

japanese:
わざとではないんですけどね。
アパート暮らしの時は、隣で寝ていた三玖に
よく怒られました。
translation:
It's not like I do it on purpose, you know.
When we were living in an apartment,
I was often scolded by Miku, who slept next to me.

japanese:
ふ～ん。
それじゃ、お兄ちゃんも大変だねー。
translation:
Hmm.
That means you'll be in big trouble, big bro.

japanese:
俺の寝相はそこまで悪くないぞ。
知ってるだろ。
translation:
My sleeping position isn't that bad, you know.
You know that.

japanese: そうじゃなくてー。
translation: That's not what I meant.

japanese:
あーあ。
お兄ちゃんの恋愛オンチは、
そう簡単には治りそうもないなぁ。
translation:
*sigh*
Big bro, the ignorance you have of your own
love life isn't so easily fixed, is it.
...Huh?

japanese:
私ね、２人のことを聞いてから、
お付き合いするってどんな感じなんだろうなぁって
考えてたんだ。
translation:
After hearing about you two,
I was thinking I'd get to see what it would be like
to date someone.

japanese:
でも、２人を見てると
思ってたのとはちょっと違うなって。
translation:
But, when I see
the two of you together, it's a little different.

japanese:
お兄ちゃんと四葉さんって、
恋人同士というより仲の良い友達みたい。
translation:
Big bro and Yotsuba-san, it's like you're
more good friends than lovers.

japanese: ……やっぱり、そう見えるのか。
translation: ...So, that's how it looks, eh?

japanese:
あはは……。
二乃や三玖にもよく言われます。
translation:
Ahaha... Nino and Miku
say the same thing to me all the time.

japanese:
あ、でも！
正しいお付き合いの形なんてないって言うし、
お兄ちゃんたちには、それが合ってるんだよ。
translation:
Ah, but! There's no right way to date,
and if it works for you two,
then that's what's important.

japanese:
はー……。
らいはちゃんは大人ですねぇ。
translation:
*sigh*
You really are mature, Raiha-chan.

japanese: お前はもうすぐ大学生だが？
translation: You're almost in college, aren't you? Yotsuba?

japanese: うわ、そうでした！
translation: Uwaaa that's right!

japanese:
（それにしても……友達みたい、か。
　らいはにまで言われちまうとは）
translation:
(And yet...it's like we're friends, huh?
 Even Raiha's saying that.)

japanese:
（確かにいまのままじゃ、
　恋人同士には見られないだろう自覚はある）
translation:
(Certainly, as we are now, I feel
 like we can't really be seen as lovers.)

japanese:
（だからこそ、この旅行中に四葉との仲を深めて
　俺からキスを……）
translation:
(Then, we really do need to deepen our relationship
 on this trip, and maybe I should take the lead
 and finally kiss her...)

japanese:
そうだよ。
四葉さんも大学生になるんだし、
もっと積極的にならなきゃね。
translation:
That's right. Yotsuba-san is also going to college,
so you two need to be more proactive.

japanese: せ、積極的に？
translation: P-proactive?

japanese: 例えば、お兄ちゃんにチュー――
translation: Like, kissing big bro%p-2;――

japanese:
そ、それよりですね！？
明日からの話をしましょう！
translation:
C-can we change the topic?!
Why don't we talk about it tomorrow, huh?!

japanese:
明日は、この旅行のメインディッシュというべき
海ですからね！
translation:
Tomorrow is the main event of this trip!
We're going the beach!

japanese:
沖縄の海かぁ。
きっと、すごく綺麗なんだろうなぁ。
translation:
Wow, an Okinawan beach.
It must be really beautiful.

japanese:
マリンアクティビティにバーベキューと
いっぱい計画してますから、らいはちゃんも
楽しみにしていてください。
translation:
You should look forward to tomorrow Raiha-chan.
We have a barbecue and a lot of beach activities
planned for everyone.

japanese:
うん！
ねえ、アクティビティってなにするの？
translation:
Yeah!
Hey, what kind of activities are we going to do?

japanese:
ししし。
それは明日になってからのお楽しみです。
きっと気に入りますよ？
translation:
Hee-hee.
That's a surprise for tomorrow.
I'm sure you'll love it though!

japanese:
なんたって、私たちが全員揃って卒業できた
記念旅行ですからね。
translation:
This is a commemorative trip 
celebrating our graduation after all.

japanese:
みんなの思い出に残るような、
そんな最高の旅行にしてみせます！
translation:
I'm gonna make this the best trip
that no one will forget!

japanese: そうか。
translation: I see.

japanese:
（四葉らしいというか……
　こういうところは相変わらずだな）
translation:
(That's Yotsuba for you...
 In that respect, she hasn't changed at all.)

japanese: （俺は……少し気負いすぎてるのかもしれない）
translation: (Maybe...I'm just a little too tense.)

japanese:
（卒業旅行はまだ始まったばかりなんだ。
　まずは、四葉が望むように
　一緒に楽しい思い出を作ろう）
translation:
(Our graduation trip has just begun.
 First, let's make fun memories together
 just like Yotsuba wants.)

japanese:
よし、明日からが本番だ！
２人とも寝坊なんかするんじゃないぞ？
translation:
All right, the main event starts tomorrow!
Don't oversleep, either of you!

japanese: はーい！
translation: Yeah!
